title: ion-back-button
body: The back button navigates back in the app's history upon click. It is smart enough to know what to render based on the mode and when to show based on the navigation stack.
To change what is displayed in the back button, use the

<!-- Back button with custom text and icon -->
<!-- Back button with no text and custom icon -->

<!-- Back button with custom text and icon -->

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: defaultHref
props.docs: The url to navigate back to by default when there is no history.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the button.

props.name: icon
props.docs: The icon name to use for the back button.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: text
props.docs: The text to display in the back button.

docs:
The back button navigates back in the app's history upon click. It is smart enough to know what to render based on the mode and when to show based on the navigation stack.

To change what is displayed in the back button, use the `text` and `icon` properties.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

styles.name: --background
styles.docs: Background of the button

styles.docs: Background of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-focused-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button background when focused with the tab key

styles.docs: Background of the button on hover

styles.name: --background-hover-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the background on hover
